alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Sebastian (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:57AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Franklin, southern Crawford, Sebastian, southeastern Haskell, eastern Sequoyah and northern Le Flore Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 357 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Brushy to 5 miles southeast of Gans to 5 miles northwest of Mc Curtain. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Poteau... Charleston... Cedarville... Greenwood... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Lavaca... Spiro... Arkoma... Mulberry... Panama... Mansfield... Dyer... Hackett... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 17. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 306 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
